page.title: 19Play Area Dalgety Bay.
page.content: Next to Donibristle House is the cricket pitch surrounded by bushes, shrubberies, wild flowers and very old trees, some over lOO years old. The cricket pitch is no longer used for cricket instead many people walk the dog there and it is a favourite play area for children living nearby. Children now play football and tennis on the cricket pitch and often climb the surrounding trees. Children also like to pretend they are famous explorers and find new pathways and tunnels through the thick intertwining bushes. You will find small groups of children playing hide-and-seek. One child closes their eyes and counts to lOO while the others hide. After counting to lOO the seeker looks for the other children until all have been found. The first to be found becomes the seeker in the new game.
